Articles.Content:
You're already getting an armadillo facsimile, don't push it...

...Ãƒâ€_Ã…Â what are you getting at?

What she's getting at is that there will be an armadillo-like creature involved at some point.

To clarify, facsimile comes from Latin, and means "make similar". In modern usage, it exclusively refers to something that is either a direct copy or very similar of something else.

Edited June 5, 2013 by satcharna

Edit: What she said is a better reasoning... ^^

She's getting an reproduction or a copy of an armadillo, give me a sec, and I'll put the wiktionary quotes here...

Noun

facsimile (plural facsimiles)

1. A copy or reproduction.

2. A fax, a machine for making and sending copies of printed material and images via radio or telephone network.

3. The image sent by the machine itself.

Noun

armadillo (plural armadillos or armadilloes)

Any of a family of burrowing mammals covered with bony, jointed, protective plates, genus Dasypus.

Edited June 5, 2013 by MmPMSFmM
Well... Didn't see her post.

I was just being stupid in that comment ignore it.

So, Armadillo things: Nine-Banded Armadillo or the Giant Armadillo from South America?

I know 'bout them Armadillos.

I was just being stupid in that comment ignore it.

So, Armadillo things: Nine-Banded Armadillo or the Giant Armadillo from South America?

Probably armadilloish.

Probably armadilloish.

Armadilloish can cover a pretty large range of appearances. You can get your standard Nine-Banded one, or something that looks like a giant tortoise. That's why you'll have to be specific...Partner...
I think we can agree that it will be armadilloish. Such as a shell.
Perhaps it will even jump into the fenders of oncoming traffic. Just think of a rat-like creature with leathery armour-plates.

I think we can agree that it will be armadilloish. Such as a shell.

Even the shells(HIDES!DARNIT) Differ between species, Observe:

Giant Armadillo: native to south America.

Nine-Banded Armadillo: Native to Texas.

Perhaps it will even jump into the fenders of oncoming traffic. Just think of a rat-like creature with leathery armour-plates.

This Is the size of a Giant Armadillo compared to us. Not something you'd wanna hit. with your car.

Meanwhile, there's the nine-banded armadillo.

Isn't he cute?

Very cute.

Anyway, I thought about looking at prehistoric extinct armadillos.

... To be honest, this is our most on-topic topic we've discussed for the last 50 pages or so...

Anyway, I'm off to sleep. G'night!
Chobit's original Freya character (pre-PfL, many years ago...) had a pet Nine-Banded. Named Panzer-Rat. I was asked to put it in the story. Because Chobit asked nicely... the critter'll be there.

...so my Armadillo knowledge is useless?

(also:Enigmas been slaughtered)

We best not talk about Enigmas or the mighty hammer of the mods comes down upon us.
